item.title: This Week in Spring - January 6th, 2026
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded:
Hi, Spring fans, to the first installment of This Week in Spring in the new year and, roughly, the fifteenth anniversary edition of this series! I've been writing these blogs since the first week of January of 2011, and I am proud to say that I haven't (so far) missed a single week! I've always published it on Tuesday (with some fuzziness around whose Tuesday, as I tend to bounce around the globe a fair bit). I want to thank, as I always do, Spring cofounder Keith Donald for this wonderful and simple idea. He dropped it in my lap and said to give it a shot, and I've never looked back. He's no longer with the company, sadly, but he was a very fun person to learn from. I am rather stupid, and he took the time to guide me, a kindness for which I remain eternally grateful.

It's a new year, and a new Tuesday, and that means a new roundup. So, let's dive right into it!

  • in last week's installment of A Bootiful Podcast, I talked to Apache Tomcat legend Mark Thomas
  • Spring Shell 4.0.0 GA has been released
  • I liked this post (replete with the usual clickbait and SEO optimizations) on optimizing a Spring Boot application that was using 2GB of RAM to instead use 200MBs.
  • Another banger over on Baeldung, this one on logging queries with Spring Data Cassandra
  • I love this outlook post from Spring AI lead Christian Tsolov
  • Spring Boot Istio 1.2.0 Released! It includes some niceties like auto fault generation, auto gateway generation & injection, auto HTTP matches generation, and more. See the release notes here
  • Hey, are you using the Open Session in View (ant-) pattern? It's enabled by default as a developer ergonomics feature in Spring Boot, but maybe you should disable it. Check out this post by Simon Martinelli for the 411
  • Baeldung also have a nice post explaining how to use FaunaDB with Spring
  • this is an interesting pokst on how to use Spring AI to bridge the gap between Java and Generative AI (Does this mean there's no more gap?)
  • I liked this French-language video looking at how to build a Spring AI MCP and Telegram client
  • Nice! Here's a nice post on using Spring AI with Amazon Bedrock (pt. 1)
